p.s: The given text is an extract from the play Romeo and Juliet by William Shakespeare which stems from the Oxford School Shakespeare, new edition published in 2008.
In this particular scene, Juliet and Romeo are secretly meeting in the Capulet's garden.
When Romeo comes out of hiding Juliet expresses her concerns about him being there.
Because Romeo is a Montague she fears that he might be found by her family's people and as a consequence killed.
Romeo assures her that he is willing to take this risk because he is in love with her and this love will not stop him from seeing her.
Next, Juliet repeats her concerns but Romeo keeps assuring her that he is ready to withstand the threat coming from her relatives.
Lastly, Romeo argues that he is well hidden thanks to the dark and stresses again that he is aware of the risk yet does not want it to stop him from seeing her.
